entry.title: the bathing ghat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 19th-century construction of the bathing ghat (pictured) at Bulandshahr was delayed because an executive engineer deemed it an "eye-sore"?

entry.title: Aly Tewfik Shousha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Aly Tewfik Shousha, a founding member of the World Health Organization, died while attending the WHO executive meeting in Geneva?

entry.title: swivel weaving (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a swivel weaving technique was used by cloud brocade weavers in Ming-dynasty China?

entry.title: a simple polygon through all the points (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a simple polygon through all the points of a three-by-three grid must pass straight through some of the points, rather than turning at each of them?

entry.title: Philippine citizenship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that foreign nationals wishing to gain Philippine citizenship need to demonstrate proficiency in English or Spanish as well as a Philippine language?

entry.title: al-Mufaddal ibn Umar al-Ju'fi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to some Shi'i Muslim authors who wrote under the name of al-Mufaddal ibn Umar al-Ju'fi, unbelievers will be reincarnated into animal, vegetable, or mineral bodies?

entry.title: A Space for the Unbound (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the game director for A Space for the Unbound wanted to preserve his memories as an Indonesian through the game?

entry.title: millennials pause (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... ... that millennials pause?
